creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
assuming you are talking about C++ compilation, you need the C++ compiler tasks
from ant-contrib.sf.net. They work very well, although can be fiddly to set up
-as C++ compilation is fiddly.

I dont know anyone who has wrapped MASM. If I were to wrap an assembler, I'd go
for NASM myself, it being cross platform and more up to date than masm anyway.

go to ant-contrib.sf.net site. download the cpp tasks (or build them from CVS),
taskdef them and then use them.
